The town of Palos was heavily involved in the late medieval Atlantic trade and the American trade from the time of Columbus. Many of its young men left for the Americas in the early colonial years. A nucleus of a community of African descent began there due to the slave trade and the local demand for labor; free people of color later joined that community. 45.
